meta.description: MSPI transforms MSP operations through AI-powered intelligence. From billing cultivation to agentic service delivery.

hero.title: The intelligence layer your MSP deserves
hero.subtitle: AI-powered revenue cultivation, compliance automation, and strategic advisory that transforms MSP operations overnight.

problem.line1: Unbilled hours. License drift. Scope creep.
problem.line2: The average MSP leaks 8-12% of billable revenue.
problem.line3: Your tools don't talk. Your data is scattered. You're bleeding money.

home.sliversHint: A fleet of Slivers tending your revenue garden

howitworks.title: From setup to ROI in three simple steps
howitworks.subtitle: Our Slivers work autonomously to find and recover revenue while you focus on growing your business.

step1.title: Connect your stack
step1.desc: Integrate with ConnectWise, Autotask, HaloPSA, Datto, NinjaOne, and more. Setup takes less than 30 minutes with our secure API connections.

step2.title: Slivers analyze daily
step2.desc: Our AI agents continuously monitor your operations, detecting billing gaps, compliance issues, and optimization opportunities around the clock.

step3.title: Harvest your revenue
step3.desc: Review findings in your daily 15-minute brief, approve recommendations, and watch your recovered revenue grow week over week.

testimonials.title: Trusted by MSPs worldwide
testimonials.quote: MSPI recovered $127,000 in our first quarter alone. The unbilled hours we were missing were staggering. Now our revenue matches our actual service delivery, and our margins have never been healthier.

modulesIntro.title: Operational Modules
modulesIntro.subtitle: Each module compounds the intelligence of every other

m01.name: Revenue Intelligence
m01.description: The profit engine. License reconciliation, contract leakage detection, billing integrity automation. Every dollar found, every margin protected.

m02.name: Data Quality Factory
m02.description: The hygiene engine. Deduplication, entity resolution, stale asset purging. Clean data is the foundation of accurate intelligence.

m03.name: Service Desk Autopilot
m03.description: The labor saver. AI-powered triage, skill-based dispatch, technician copilot, agentic resolution. Tickets that resolve themselves.

m04.name: Technical Service Delivery
m04.description: Fleet command & control. Alert aggregation, drift detection, patch management, backup verification. Every device, every system, every moment.

m05.name: Client Experience Portal
m05.description: The face of your MSP. Branded self-service, approval workflows, executive dashboards. Transparency that builds trust.

m06.name: Identity & Security
m06.description: The shield. ITDR, SSPM, continuous risk scoring, incident response orchestration. Security posture that never sleeps.

m07.name: Compliance Factory
m07.description: Audit proof. Framework mapping, evidence auto-capture, continuous compliance posture. Real-time, not point-in-time.

m08.name: Documentation Factory
m08.description: The brain. Dynamic docs that update themselves, SOP generation from resolutions, knowledge base that grows automatically.

m09.name: Lifecycle Factory
m09.description: Onboarding to offboarding. 30-day sprint tracking, provisioning workflows, standards adoption. Every transition handled.

m10.name: Strategy Studio
m10.description: The upmarket engine. vCIO automation, QBR narrative generation, AI advisory (vCAIO), roadmap planning. Strategy that scales.

m11.name: Asset Lifecycle
m11.description: Hardware & software. Warranty tracking, refresh forecasting, disposal compliance. Every asset accounted for.

m12.name: Customer Success
m12.description: The retention engine. Account health scoring, churn prediction, renewal management. Relationships that compound.

m13.name: Expansion Toolkit
m13.description: Sales & marketing outputs. Upsell radar, proposal generation, case study automation. Growth from within.

m14.name: Procurement
m14.description: The commercial engine. Vendor catalog, procurement workflows, margin tracking. Every purchase optimized.

m15.name: People & Execution
m15.description: Internal MSP operations. Role scorecards, hiring playbooks, operational cadence. Your team, amplified.

m16.name: Reporting & Analytics
m16.description: Unified BI. Custom report builder, benchmark packs, predictive analytics. Data that drives decisions.

m17.name: Marketplace
m17.description: The ecosystem moat. Template library, community patterns, partner integrations. Intelligence that compounds across the industry.

identity.title: Identity-First Architecture
identity.description: Cross-tenant RBAC + delegation with Entra/Okta native integration. Security that scales.

dataGraph.description: User ↔ Device ↔ License ↔ Ticket ↔ Alert ↔ Contract relationships enable cross-domain intelligence.

roi.description: Touches, minutes saved, and revenue found/protected tracked automatically. Value you can prove.

agentic.title: Agentic Resolution
agentic.description: AI executes approved runbooks before human involvement, with proper guardrails. Automation that acts.

compliance.title: Continuous Compliance
compliance.description: Real-time posture, not point-in-time audits. Evidence auto-capture with freshness tracking.

documentation.title: Dynamic Documentation
documentation.description: Assets update their own documentation pages automatically. Knowledge that maintains itself.

iso.title: AI on Rails
iso.subtitle: ISO 27001 Certified
iso.description: MSPI is ISO 27001 certified. Every service we deliver, every infrastructure we manage, every outcome we achieve—all within a continuous, internationally recognized information security management system.
iso.theirApproachDesc: SOC 2 attestation. A point-in-time snapshot. Compliance theater that expires the moment the auditor leaves.
iso.mspiApproachDesc: ISO 27001. Continuous ISMS. Enterprise-grade security governance extended to every client we touch. We show up for audits.
iso.quote: We hand you the Ferrari and let you floor it without fear of death, because we put it on redundant safety rails. That's what real fiduciaries do—they keep their clients safe from harm known and unknown.

slivers.title: Slivers
slivers.subtitle: A fleet of specialized AI agents tending your revenue garden

intro.description: Traditional MSP billing is {{forensic}}—monthly reconciliation, hunting for lost revenue in old records. The Sliver model is {{cultivation}}—daily tending of the revenue garden.

model.label: The Model
model.title: Cultivation, Not Forensics
model.description: Slivers work continuously—sensing changes, unifying entities across systems, detecting opportunities, validating findings, and presenting the daily harvest for human approval.
model.traditionalDesc: Forensic approach. Hunting for lost revenue in old records. Seeds rot before anyone notices.
model.mspiDesc: Cultivation approach. Daily tending ensures every seed planted becomes a harvest. No opportunity left behind.

introSection.p1: Traditional MSP billing is forensic—monthly reconciliation, hunting for lost revenue in old records. The Sliver model is cultivation—daily tending of the revenue garden.
introSection.p2: Every day at an MSP plants seeds: a technician takes a call (billable time), a customer adds a user (license revenue), a device checks in (managed service value), a backup runs (contractual obligation).
introSection.p3: Left untended, seeds rot. The Slivers ensure every seed becomes a harvest.

fleet.title: The Sliver Fleet
fleet.description: Each Sliver is a specialist. Together, they form a complete revenue intelligence system.

sensorPSA.name: Sensor:PSA
sensorPSA.description: Pulls all billing-relevant data from your PSA. Time entries with billable status, agreement terms, invoice history, company records.

sensorDistributor.name: Sensor:Distributor
sensorDistributor.description: Pulls subscription and usage data from distributor portals. The source of truth for what licenses you're paying for.

sensorAccounting.name: Sensor:Accounting
sensorAccounting.description: Reads invoice and payment status. Detects sync failures—PSA invoice exists, accounting invoice missing.

sensorRMM.name: Sensor:RMM
sensorRMM.description: Counts managed endpoints, tracks technician remote sessions, monitors operational events. Reveals work that may not have been logged.

resolver.name: Resolver
resolver.description: The critical glue. Matches "Acme Corp" in PSA to "Acme Corporation" in distributor to "ACME CORP." in accounting. Uses 3-model consensus for accuracy.

detector.name: Detector
detector.description: Runs detection rules: unbilled time older than 7 days, license count mismatches, device coverage gaps, invoice sync failures. Quantifies every finding.

documentation.name: Documentation
documentation.description: Cross-references RMM activity with logged tickets and time entries. Finds unticketed work, time discrepancies, activity mismatches.

coverage.name: Coverage
coverage.description: Compares actual service delivery against agreement terms. Detects scope creep (providing unpaid services) and coverage gaps (agreements that don't match reality).

reviewerAmount.name: Reviewer:Amount
reviewerAmount.description: Validates calculations. Hours × Rate = Amount. Verifies rates match agreement terms. Checks quantity gaps are accurate.

reviewerEntity.name: Reviewer:Entity
reviewerEntity.description: Confirms entity IDs reference real records. Verifies company resolution is correct. Catches orphaned references.

reviewerHistory.name: Reviewer:History
reviewerHistory.description: Compares against historical patterns. Is this a known false positive? Was a similar alert previously resolved? Does the pattern match confirmed true positives?

reporter.name: Reporter
reporter.description: Generates the Daily Cultivation Report—everything needed to harvest the day's revenue in 5-15 minutes. Yields ready, items needing attention, credits to issue.

proposer.name: Proposer
proposer.description: Creates invoice drafts and correction proposals. Every line item has evidence references. Includes confidence scores and reversal paths. Never creates actual invoices.

architecture.title: Safety Architecture
architecture.description: Slivers operate in tiers based on risk. Higher tiers require human approval.

tier0.label: Tier
tier0.title: Autonomous
tier0.description: Read-only operations. Sensors, Resolver, Detectors, Reviewers. Cannot cause harm. Run continuously without approval.

tier2.label: Tier
tier2.title: HIL-Gated
tier2.description: Internal write operations. Invoice creation, agreement updates. Requires human approval. Every action logged.

tier3.label: Tier
tier3.title: External
tier3.description: Operations affecting external systems. Syncing to accounting, sending invoices. Requires explicit additional approval.

yields.title: Yields
yields.description: Every revenue opportunity detected by the Slivers is called a Yield. Yields are categorized, quantified, and presented for harvest.

safety.title: Safety Guarantees
safety.subtitle: Enterprise-grade guardrails for every operation
safety.isoDesc: Every Sliver operation runs within a continuous ISMS. Not a point-in-time audit—a permanent security management system.
safety.automaticDesc: Data reading, entity matching, leakage detection, validation, report generation, draft preparation.
safety.approvalDesc: Invoice creation, agreement modification, customer record changes, accounting sync, external communication.
safety.escalatesDesc: Confidence below 80%, reviewers disagree, first-time patterns, amounts over threshold, uncertain identity.
safety.consensusDesc: Critical decisions use three independent models. Disagreement always escalates to humans. No single point of reasoning failure.
safety.railsDesc: Like a bobsled on a luge track. Do whatever you want with your sled—you won't jump out. Enterprise-grade guardrails for everyone.

hil.title: Human-in-the-Loop Gate
hil.description: Slivers detect, validate, and propose. Humans approve. No invoice is created, no agreement modified, no action taken without explicit human authorization.

cta.title: Intelligence that cultivates
cta.description: Slivers work while you sleep. Every morning, the harvest is ready.

opening.lead: The MSP industry is not slow. It is static.
opening.p1: For twenty years, managed services followed the same physics: add headcount, add tools, add tickets. Linear scaling. Constant velocity. The math never changed because the model never evolved.
opening.p2: MSPI rejects constant velocity. We pursue acceleration.
opening.p3: MSPI is not just a platform. It's a rate of change. Where traditional MSPs measure progress in endpoints managed, we measure the rate at which capability itself compounds.
opening.p4: We are not linear. We are exponential.

inward.title: Intelligence Inward
inward.body: Traditional MSPs chase every new tool, every shiny feature. Their capabilities scatter outward. MSPI pulls intelligence inward—consolidating into AI systems that learn, adapt, and compound. Every ticket resolved makes the next resolution faster. Every process documented makes the next documentation automatic. Centripetal force creates capability centers.

leverage.title: Leverage Over Labor
leverage.body: Force is hiring another technician. Torque is building an agent that does the work of ten. Traditional MSPs push harder. MSPI finds pivot points. We don't ask "how many engineers do we need?" We ask "where does one engineer become infinite?" The answer is always the lever.

momentum.title: Momentum Preserved, Inertia Destroyed
momentum.body: Keep what works: client trust, deep relationships, institutional knowledge. Destroy what resists: manual processes, tribal knowledge hoarding, "that's how we've always done it." Conservation is intentional. So is demolition. MSPI knows the difference.

friction.title: Friction is a Choice
friction.body: Every approval chain is chosen. Every manual handoff is chosen. Every unbilled minute is chosen. Friction is not inherent to service delivery—it is designed into it. MSPI designs it out. We eliminate the barriers between problem and resolution, between intent and execution. What remains is pure velocity.

compound.title: Compound Curves
compound.body: Simple operations repeat. Compound operations spiral. Each automation enables the next automation. Each insight feeds the next insight. Each client success pattern becomes a template for the next client. The curve doesn't flatten—it steepens. This is not growth. This is acceleration of growth.

flywheel.label: The Flywheel Effect
flywheel.description: Each rotation of the flywheel accelerates the next. The gap between ingestion and action compresses. Eventually, it disappears.

antiPatterns.title: What We Reject
items: Five-year technology roadmaps written in stone
Constant velocity operations: "We've always grown 10% per year"
The belief that clients fear AI more than they fear irrelevance

items.text: Cultivate, don't excavate. Daily tending of the revenue garden beats monthly forensic accounting.
Automate the automation. If you're still building runbooks by hand, you're building them wrong.
Trust but verify—with consensus. Three models agree before action. Disagreement escalates.
Human-in-the-loop, not human-in-the-way. Approval gates exist for execution, not for observation.
Measure the rate, not the number. How fast you improve matters more than where you start.

technical.title: Technical Acceleration
technical.description: Not how many systems we manage, but how fast our management capability itself improves. AI agents that write better runbooks than last week. Automations that spawn automations. The stack evolves faster than any roadmap predicted.

operational.title: Operational Acceleration
operational.description: Not how many tickets we close, but how fast our resolution velocity increases. Response times that halve quarterly. Escalation rates that asymptote toward zero. Operations that get lighter as scale increases.

strategic.title: Strategic Acceleration
strategic.description: Not how many clients we serve, but how fast our value delivery compounds. QBRs that generate themselves. Roadmaps that predict before clients ask. Trust that deepens because we see around corners they can't.

isoSection.lead1: All this acceleration. All this intelligence. All this autonomy. It demands guardrails that never fail.
isoSection.lead2: MSPI is ISO 27001 certified. Not your SOC 2 attestation—a point-in-time snapshot, compliance theater that expires the moment the auditor leaves. We're talking about a continuous, internationally recognized information security management system.
isoSection.lead3: We extended enterprise-grade security governance to every client we touch. We show up for audits. Because that's what real fiduciaries do.
isoSection.quote: We hand you the Ferrari and let you floor it without fear of death, because we put it on redundant safety rails. That's what real fiduciaries do—they keep their clients safe from harm known and unknown.

quote.text: "Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world."

commitment.title: Our Commitment
commitment.description: We commit to building intelligence that compounds, systems that teach themselves, and partnerships that accelerate together. The future belongs to those who accelerate toward it.

cta.title:
Stop growing.
Start accelerating your growth.
cta.description: The MSPs that win will not be the largest. They will be the fastest—and accelerating. The gap between those who adopt AI and those who resist will not be measured in market share. It will be measured in survival.

footer.tagline: AI-powered intelligence for modern MSPs. Recover revenue, automate compliance, and scale your operations.
